site_title: Debt capital market issuance volumes expected to remain ‘relatively stable’ in 2025
summary: Singapore's debt capital market is expected to remain relatively stable in 2025, with financials and strong issuers expected to continue dominating the market. Despite potential headwinds from policy easing by the Monetary Authority of Singapore, issuance volumes are expected to be similar to 2024, driven by healthy investor demand and attractive yields. Geopolitical uncertainties and inflation will pose challenges, but Singapore issuers are expected to tap into global G3 currencies to meet funding needs. Financials are expected to remain major issuers in the Singapore dollar market, driven by their asset loan book business model.

images.alt_text: Ranamita Chakraborty

Singapore’s financial sector had remained resilient in 2023, with good progress across the board, said Chia Der Jiun, managing director of the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) at the release of the central bank’s annual report on Thursday (Jul 18).
Singapore’s government-issued bonds, such as T-bills, have drawn strong interest this year, after yields crossed the four per cent mark in January and September.

site_title: Mapletree Logistics Trust to divest Malaysia property for RM31.5 million
summary: Mapletree Logistics Trust has agreed to divest its Malaysia property, Subang 2, for RM31.5 million (S$9.6 million). The sale price is 31.3% higher than its latest valuation of RM24 million. The divestment is expected to be completed in the first half of FY25/26 and will not impact MLT's net asset value and net property income. The trust's portfolio will consist of 178 properties after the sale. The capital released will provide greater financial flexibility for MLT to pursue high-specification logistics facilities.

images.alt_text: Crystal Heng
The sale price of S$12.3 million is 35.2 per cent above the latest valuation of S$9.1 million, as at Oct 1, 2024., the manager of Mapletree Logistics Trust says.

site_title: Slide in land sales persists as China’s property developers pushed to the brink
summary: China's land sales plummeted 16% year-over-year in 2024, reaching 1.38 billion square meters, the lowest levels in years. This decline, coupled with a 20% drop in property sales, has pushed developers to the brink, forcing them to scale back investments and land purchases to ensure survival. Land sales have cooled nationwide as developers scramble to reduce debt and offload assets, with some regions seeing declines of up to 50%.

images.alt_text: SenseTime is giving up a roughly 11,000 square foot space in Frasers Tower for a less central building, sources say.
As problems in China's real estate sector persist, local property groups may do well to shift their overseas focus to Asean.
China’s 10-year and 30-year treasury yields both hit record lows on Friday on expectations of fresh monetary easing.

site_title: Singaporean households can now claim S$300 CDC vouchers, half for use at supermarkets
summary: Singaporean households can now claim S$300 CDC vouchers, which are valid until Dec 31, 2025. The vouchers can be split in half for use at supermarkets or participating hawker stalls and heartland merchants. This is part of the Assurance Package aimed at alleviating daily expenses, following a previous S$300 voucher disbursement in June 2024.

images.alt_text: The electronics sector’s PMI eased slightly to 51.4 in December, down from 51.6 in November.
The latest issuance will be allotted on Jan 27, with successful applications issued on Feb 3.

"2024 too had its share of difficulties. The government did not get everything right in the first instance. But as always, we were upfront with Singaporeans when we fell short and could have done better", said PM Wong.

site_title: Stocks to watch: Keppel DC Reit
summary: Keppel DC Reit announced plans to divest its 99% stake in Basis Bay Data Centre in Cyberjaya, Malaysia, for RM55.6 million (S$16.9 million), with the sale expected to be completed by the third quarter of 2025. The counter rose 1.4% following the news.

images.alt_text: Chloe Lim

site_title: What investors expect from Trump
summary: Investors expect US President-elect Donald Trump to continue generating high profits for American companies, with share prices expected to rise 3% since his election. However, uncertainty over tariffs, immigration, and fiscal policy may lead to market volatility, particularly in Treasury bonds. Investors are betting on a stronger US dollar and expect exporters' currencies to decline. Trump's policies may lead to inflation and higher interest rates, but a turbulent Treasury market could negatively impact his presidency, prompting bondholders to reassess their expectations.

images.alt_text: Given the broad consensus on China’s threat, tariffs on Chinese imports will inevitably rise. China has over US$300 billion trade deficit with the US
President-elect Donal Trump's return to the White House sets the stage for resets in globalisation, multilateralism and economic blocs.

site_title: Singapore’s next general election: What to expect
summary: Singapore's next general election, scheduled by November 2025, will be Prime Minister Lawrence Wong's first since taking office. The election's timing remains unclear, but observers predict it may occur in March to April, May to June, or September. Key issues include the cost of living, housing, immigration, and geopolitics. This will be Wong's biggest test to date, and the PAP's campaign is expected to focus on Forward Singapore, a platform launched by Wong.

images.alt_text: Elysia Tan

SM Lee (left) with PM Wong at the PAP conference on Nov 24, 2024. Said SM Lee: “We have to work very hard to make sure that voters understand that they cannot afford to treat this next GE as a by-election. What’s at stake is the future of Singapore."

site_title: Tesla annual deliveries fall for first time as incentives fail to drum up demand
summary: Tesla reported its first annual delivery decline, with 1.79 million vehicles sold in 2024, 1.1% lower than the previous year, due to reduced European subsidies, increased competition from China's BYD, and higher borrowing costs. The company's shares fell 6% after the announcement. Despite a strong 2024 year-end, Tesla's deliveries missed estimates, and the company's growth is expected to slow due to market saturation. Elon Musk is pivoting his focus to building a self-driving taxi business and has backed President-elect Donald Trump with campaign donations, hoping for easier regulations to aid Tesla's growth.

images.alt_text: Musk’s potential to have extraordinary clout with the Trump administration raises questions about the fate of federal investigations and regulatory actions affecting his business empire, of which at least 20 are ongoing.
The remains of a covered Tesla Cybertruck that exploded at the entrance of Trump Tower in Las Vegas, Nevada, Jan 1, 2025.

The German government on Monday accused Elon Musk, who owns social media platform X and is CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, of trying to influence the upcoming election with a guest opinion piece for the Welt am Sonntag newspaper.

site_title: Singapore retail sales unexpectedly dip 0.7% in November, with mixed performance across industries
summary: Singapore's retail sales unexpectedly declined 0.7% in November, reversing October's 2.4% growth. This was a surprise to private-sector economists, who predicted a 1.5% expansion. Only half of the 14 industries reported year-on-year growth, with supermarkets and hypermarkets experiencing a 2% increase. The unexpected decline was attributed to mixed performance across industries.

images.alt_text: Elysia Tan

site_title: Maybank says SingPost can potentially offer a ‘significant’ special dividend after sales of assets
summary: Maybank maintains its buy rating on SingPost, predicting a potentially "significant" special dividend after the sale of its Australian logistics business and freight forwarding business Famous Holdings. The sale is expected to conclude by end January 2025, generating proceeds of S$80-100 million. SingPost's cash position is expected to rise to S$1.3 billion, surpassing its existing debt of S$1.1 billion. Maybank analyst Jarick Seet believes SingPost could offer dividends exceeding its current share price.

images.alt_text: David Gerald, founder, president and chief executive of Sias, says that shareholders deserve better and so does the market.
Neo Su Yin, 44, will work with SingPost's board in a review of the group's international business unit.
SingPost says customers are aware of the clauses and conditions covering delivery failure.

site_title: Daily Debrief: What Happened Today (Jan 3)
summary: Retail sales in Singapore rose 2% in November, with supermarkets and hypermarkets seeing a 2% increase. The country's households can now claim S$300 CDC vouchers for use at supermarkets. Meanwhile, power consumption growth is expected to boost renewables and LNG sectors in 2025, but with a premium for more sustainable energy. Singapore plays a key role in powering Indonesia's green energy goals, according to the country's ambassador. The country is also gearing up for its next general election, with Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong's term set to expire in the next 6-12 months.

site_title: ComfortDelGro adds Toyota Alphard Hybrid models to limousine taxi fleet
summary: ComfortDelGro has introduced 40 new Toyota Alphard Hybrid models to its limousine taxi fleet, aligning with growing demand for premium transportation services. The move is expected to benefit drivers with higher fares, while providing passengers with an enhanced travel experience. The new models, priced at S$387,888, feature luxury features such as ventilated seats and massage functions, and are expected to be delivered by the end of Q1 2025, with an additional 40 units to follow.

images.alt_text: Michelle Zhu
With this revision, the platform fee for rides booked through the Zig, DBS PayLah! and Kris+ apps will be adjusted to a range of S$1 to S$1.20, depending on the distance travelled and waiting time.
The Land Transport Authority said that all existing point-to-point sector operator licencees will have their respective licences renewed,
For the nine months ended September 2024, ComfortDelgro's net profit rose to S$152.8 million from S$128.4 million in the year-ago period.
The addition of Addison Lee will extend ComfortDelGro’s London footprint and grow its taxi and private hire network to more than 34,000 vehicles globally.

site_title: Philippine central bank says 2024 current account deficit wider than expected
summary: The Philippines' central bank predicts a wider-than-expected current account deficit of $10.4 billion in 2024, or 2.2% of GDP, and a $12.1 billion deficit in 2025 due to geopolitical shocks and potential US trade policies. Despite this, the overall balance of payments is expected to be in surplus for both years, supported by sustained inflows in the financial account. The wider deficit is attributed to trade barriers and uncertainty about incoming US President Donald Trump's policies.

images.alt_text: Budget advocates have complained about reductions in the education budget and the removal of a subsidy for the government health insurance programme, among other cuts.
Inflation has averaged 3.2 per cent for January to November, within the central bank’s 2 to 4 per cent target range for 2024.
Both Vietnam and the Philippines consider the US a key trading and geopolitical partner, and these policy changes are set to take place as the new Trump administration comes in.

site_title: Power consumption growth to boost renewables and LNG sectors in 2025
summary: Global power consumption is expected to grow 3.1% on average in 2025, with a focus on decarbonizing power sectors through renewable energy integration. Developed economies, such as France and Germany, will prioritize renewable energy due to slowing GDP growth, while emerging markets like Indonesia will experience 4.8% growth in 2024. This growth is driven by increasing power consumption from car usage and data centre operations, highlighting the importance of the renewable energy and LNG sectors in 2025.

images.alt_text: Benjamin Cher
This represents Sembcorp’s first solar and battery energy storage system hybrid project in India.

site_title: Singapore stocks struggle for direction on Friday; STI up 0.03%
summary: Singapore stocks struggled for direction on Friday, with the Straits Times Index (STI) rising 0.03% to 3,801.83. Seatrium was the top gainer, rising 5.8% to S$2.19, while Jardine Matheson Holdings fell 1.8%. Local banks UOB and OCBC were mixed, with DBS shedding 0.8%. Analyst Aidan Shevlin from JP Morgan Asset Management said moderating prices may lead to policy easing in the first half of 2025, but market volatility remains uncertain due to unreliable data.

images.alt_text: Yong Jun Yuan
Michelle Zhu
SGX indicates that the top 100 most-traded stocks had total returns of 11 per cent in the first five months of the second half of 2024.
In the first phase of development, the Kaskida project will have a capacity to produce 80,000 barrels of crude oil per day.
Keppel DC Reit's share of the consideration paid by Basis Bay Services MSC is RM55.1 million, based on its 99 per cent shareholding in Basis Bay Capital Management and the divestment consideration.

site_title: PacificLight to build S$1b hydrogen-ready power plant by 2029
summary: PacificLight Power has been awarded the right to build, own, and operate a hydrogen-ready combined cycle gas turbine (CCGT) on Jurong Island by the Energy Market Authority (EMA) for approximately S$1 billion. The project, set to be completed by 2029, will include a large-scale battery energy storage system. The greenfield site on Jurong Island will serve as the location for the new power plant.

site_title: The sound of desire: How music shapes our interactions with luxury brands
summary: A global music branding agency, Gray V, curates playlists for luxury brands to enhance the shopping experience. The agency's goal is to encourage customers to stay, align with the brand's identity, and provide seasonal inspiration. Brands like Tom Ford, James Perse, and Tiffany & Co. work with Gray V to create immersive environments through music, taking into account factors like volume, tempo, and lyrics to evoke the desired mood and atmosphere. The agency's team of experts uses a combination of research, creativity, and attention to detail to craft unique soundtracks for each brand.

images.alt_text: Celine's Hedi Slimane set the tone, introducing menswear and embellishing bags with the double-C Triomphe logo. New designer Michael Rider should be able to continue in this vein while adapting the aesthetic.

Pedestrians pass a Louis Vuitton luxury fashion store on New Bond Street in central London London, UK, on Thursday, Dec. 5, 2024. Demand for Christmas workers was barely higher in October than when Britain was in recession a year earlier, in a fresh sign of trouble for Europe’s second-largest economy. Photographer: Betty Laura Zapata/Bloomberg
LVMH is already facing pressure due to slowing sales.
LVMH sees timing as key in high-stakes foray into multi-brand luxury e-commerce

site_title: BlackRock’s Bitcoin ETF posts record outflow after banner year
summary: BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF (IBIT) experienced its largest outflow of US$333 million, marking the most withdrawn since its launch, amid a tapering of flows. This is the third consecutive day of outflows, the longest losing streak for the fund. The outflow comes after IBIT helped push Bitcoin to an all-time high of US$108,315 in mid-December, with over US$53 billion in assets and nearly US$37 billion in inflows.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: A woman passes by the Bitcoin Monument after bitcoin soared above $100,000, in Ilopango, El Salvador, December 5, 2024. REUTERS/Jose Cabezas/File Photo
FILE PHOTO: Representation of the bitcoin cryptocurrency and a price chart are seen in this illustration taken October 24, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
The world’s largest and most well-known cryptocurrency hit US$100,000 earlier this month.

An individual familiar with the state of the negotiations between BlackRock and the FDIC said the firm received the regulator’s latest proposal on Friday, less than an hour after the announcement of an Vanguard agreement.

site_title: Latest Singapore 6-month T-bill cut-off yield rises to 3.05%
summary: The Monetary Authority of Singapore announced the latest six-month Treasury bill auction, with a cut-off yield of 3.05%. The auction received S$13.7 billion in applications for the S$6.9 billion on offer, a decline from the previous auction. The median yield was 2.9%, slightly lower than the previous auction's 2.95%. Demand fell, and about 21% of competitive applications were allotted. This comes as Singapore plans to issue up to S$450 billion in government securities, with a raised limit of S$1.515 trillion until 2029.

images.alt_text: Chloe Lim
Singapore dollars notes. Tags: 钞票, 新币, 纸钞，新元，兑换率, Singapore’s strong exchange rate, currency

site_title: China’s central bank likely to cut rates in 2025, FT reports, as part of broader policy shift
summary: China's central bank is likely to cut interest rates in 2025 as part of a broader policy shift, according to the Financial Times. The People's Bank of China has set a record low for 10-year and 30-year treasury yields, signaling a move towards a more market-driven interest rate curve. Analysts expect further changes this year to ensure credit demand responds to monetary policy moves. The PBOC will prioritize interest rate adjustments and move away from quantitative objectives for loan growth, marking an interest rate reform program that government advisors have described as an "arduous task".

images.alt_text: A RRR cut – which is typically used only sparingly – could add more pressure to the Chinese currency because it sends a strong signal of monetary easing.
Chinese manufacturers maintained an optimistic view about output in 2025 though the degree of optimism eased to the lowest since September.
For steel, authorities have set a target for electric-arc furnaces to produce more than 15 per cent of total output by the end of 2025.
The onshore yuan has been relatively steady, testing the 7.3 level multiple times last month but failing to break it.

site_title: Zelensky says ‘unpredictable’ Trump could help end war
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed hope that US President-elect Donald Trump's "unpredictability" could help end the nearly three-year conflict with Russia, citing Trump's claim to end the war in "24 hours" once in power. Zelensky also supported the idea of France deploying peacekeepers in Ukraine to guarantee a future peace deal with Russia, but emphasized the need for this to be part of a broader NATO alliance.

images.alt_text: With Trump already announcing plans to slap tariffs on imports from Mexico, Canada, and China, we should certainly expect some new levies to be imposed.
Trump figurines also proved popular in 2016 when he won a first Presidential term, and in 2020 when he lost the election.

FILE PHOTO: Russian President Vladimir Putin speaks during a press conference following a meeting of the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council in the Leningrad region, Russia, December 26, 2024. Sputnik/Alexei Danichev/Pool via REUTERS ATTENTION EDITORS - THIS IMAGE WAS PROVIDED BY A THIRD PARTY./File Photo

site_title: South Korea extends Boeing 737-800 inspections following fatal crash
summary: South Korea has extended inspections of its 101 Boeing 737-800 jets following the fatal crash of a Jeju Air plane that killed 179 people. Investigators are analyzing data from 107 mobile phones, engine records, and maintenance records for clues on the cause of the crash. The inspections, initially set to end on Friday, have been extended to January 10. The investigation team will also study the plane wreckage and interview airport control tower officials, with two members set to travel to the US to analyze the flight data recorder.

images.alt_text: Tributes placed along a fence near the site where a Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 aircraft crashed and burst into flames at Muan International Airport in Muan, South Korea, Jan 2, 2025.
An official takes part in an investigation at the site where a Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 aircraft crashed and burst into flames at Muan International Airport.

site_title: Singapore’s PMI hits six-year high in December, edges up 0.1 point
summary: Singapore's Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) hit a six-year high in December, rising to 51.1, indicating growth in the country's manufacturing sector for the 16th consecutive month. The electronics sector's PMI eased slightly to 51.4, while the overall reading bodes well for the sector's performance in 2025, with experts citing resilient external demand and positive sub-indices.

images.alt_text: Renald Yeo
For the first 11 months of the year, overall manufacturing output was up 3.5 per cent year on year.
As the sector progresses in its current upcycle, analysts believe that there are some bright spots that investors could potentially pay closer attention to.

Economists told The Business Times the positive readings likely indicate some degree of front-loading of production and exports by manufacturers hoping to avoid any potential tariffs that US president-elect Donald Trump may impose.

site_title: Biden blocks sale of US Steel to Japan’s Nippon Steel
summary: US President Joe Biden has blocked the $14.9-billion sale of US Steel to Japan's Nippon Steel, citing national security concerns. The deal's collapse is expected to put thousands of jobs at risk and may force US Steel to close some steel mills. Biden stated that a strong domestically owned steel industry is essential for national security and supply chains. Nippon Steel faces a $565 million penalty payment to US Steel and has vowed to fight the decision in court. The decision may deter international investors from bidding on politically sensitive US companies.

images.alt_text: The United Steelworkers union said Nippon‘s offer fails to commit to sustaining production over the long term or enhancing domestic capacity in integrated facilities.

site_title: US: Stocks retreat in first session of 2025
summary: US stocks fell 0.4% on the first day of 2025, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average closing at 42,392.27. Tesla declined 5.8% after disappointing year-end auto sales figures, while other major indices, including the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, also dropped 0.2%. Analysts attribute the market's tepid start to the light news flow and modest trading volumes ahead of significant economic releases and the Jan 20 presidential inauguration of Donald Trump.

images.alt_text: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York City, U.S., December 10, 2024.  REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

site_title: Rolex kicks off 2025 by hiking watch prices after gold soars
summary: Rolex has raised prices on some of its most popular models, including the GMT-Master II and Day-Date, by up to 8% due to a surge in gold values in 2024. The price hikes, effective January 1, 2025, are the largest increases in years, with gold prices rising 27% in 2024. The increases are attributed to rising gold costs, labor costs, and inflation, with steel models seeing less aggressive price hikes. The price changes are indicative of the luxury watch brand's strong demand and economic strength.

images.alt_text: The Oyster Perpetual Day-Date 36 in yellow gold with a mother-of-pearl, diamond-set dial.
First launched in 1999, this cuff-style watch identified by a highly refined dial is the first women’s watch in Patek Philippe’s collection.
The Black Bay with a burgundy bezel.

runs on quartz, is a popular model that was first released in
2022. The brand recently released a limited-edition iteration.
The Vulcain Nautical Legacy Massena LAB.

site_title: Frasers Hospitality Trust soars around 40% in one month
summary: Frasers Hospitality Trust's stapled securities have surged around 40% in one month, with trading volumes also increasing significantly. The securities rose from S$0.42 on Nov 29 to S$0.59 on Dec 31, before closing at S$0.55 on Jan 3. The manager of the group attributed the movements to "significant" price and trading volume changes, but was unclear on the reason. The trust's portfolio valuation increased 2.9% year-on-year to around S$2 billion as of Sep 30, 2024, driven by the recovery in the global hospitality sector.

images.alt_text: The stapled security group recorded higher gross revenue and net property income for H2 FY2024 on continued recovery in its overall operating performance, said its managers on Tuesday (Nov 12).

site_title: US mortgage rates approach 7% in ominous sign for housing market
summary: US mortgage rates have reached 6.91% as of January 2, approaching 7% and threatening to squeeze buyers in the housing market. High borrowing costs are weighing on affordability, with the Mortgage Bankers Association's index of home-purchase applications declining nearly 7% to its lowest level since mid-November. Experts predict a "year of higher for longer" for the housing market in 2025, but a stabilizing rate could help kick-start a housing recovery.

images.alt_text: Housing affordability in the US remains under strain amid high prices and elevated borrowing costs.

site_title: OCBC assistant V-P illegally accessed bank balances of politicians, influencers
summary: A former OCBC Bank assistant vice-president, Au Jia Hao, 39, was jailed for 10 weeks for abusing his job access to illegally access 369 customers' account balances and details over eight months. He accessed the information of politicians, influencers, colleagues, friends, and family members without disclosing it to any third party, citing curiosity and stress. Au tendered his resignation in July 2023 but continued his behavior until being caught in August. He was dismissed and pleaded guilty to unauthorized access to computer material.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: OCBC Bank signage is pictured at their office in Singapore July 11, 2023. REUTERS/Edgar Su/File Photo

site_title: Steelworkers union criticises Nippon Steel’s proposal for lack of long-term commitment
summary: The United Steelworkers union criticized Nippon Steel's proposal for lacking long-term commitment to sustaining production and enhancing domestic capacity in integrated facilities. The union opposed US Steel's merger with Nippon Steel, citing concerns that Nippon's offer gives the US government veto power over potential reductions in US Steel's production capacity.

images.alt_text: Shares of US Steel surged 14 per cent on Dec 31, 2024 after the news, the biggest intra-day jump since December 2023.
The Treasury said that CFIUS agencies struggled to reach consensus on the Nippon-US Steel deal before the recommendation deadline.
The fate of the once-fabled US steelmaker has become a hot political issue since the company reached an agreement to be taken over by its Japanese suitor almost a year ago.

site_title: ETF companies are racing to launch the next ‘hot’ crypto fund
summary: ETF companies are launching new crypto-centric funds, with over a dozen planned for 2025, following a surge in crypto prices in 2024. The filings, if approved, would offer various exposure to Bitcoin and other digital assets, including S&P 500 returns in Bitcoin, convertible bonds, and futures contracts. The growth of crypto ETFs is attributed to the industry's enthusiasm following President Trump's election, which may lead to a looser regulatory stance. This trend is expected to continue in 2025, driven by bullish sentiment and increasing demand for crypto investments.

images.alt_text: The world’s largest and most well-known cryptocurrency hit US$100,000 earlier this month.
The price of Bitcoin, which typically leads market rallies, jumped from the US$69,000 level on Nov 6 to push past the US$100,000 mark a month later, buoyed by Trump’s election win.
Powell voices waning enthusiasm for interest-rate cuts and sent stocks and bonds to their worst sessions in months.

site_title: Asia: Shares rise defying slow Wall Street start to 2025
summary: Asian markets gained on Friday, defying a slow start to the US market, as the dollar advanced and markets reopened after the New Year's holiday. Hong Kong, Sydney, and Taipei stocks climbed, while South Korea's Kospi Index surged nearly two percent despite ongoing political uncertainty. The US dollar index reached its highest level against other currencies since November 2022, driven by expectations of a US economy outpacing others. Investors are gearing up for big changes in the coming weeks, including the January 20 inauguration of Donald Trump, who has threatened deep tariffs on China.

images.alt_text: The Stoxx 600 index rose 0.6 per cent to 510.67 on Thursday, reversing modest losses earlier in the session as trading volumes were light with investors still returning from their New Year holidays.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average ended 0.4 per cent lower at 42,392.27 on the first day on trading of the year.
Across the broader market, gainers firmly outweighed losers 91 to 22.

site_title: New Orleans killer acted alone, professed loyalty to jihadist group: FBI
summary: A US army veteran, Shamsud-Din Jabbar, 42, killed 14 and injured dozens in a truck attack on New Year's revellers in New Orleans' French Quarter. Preliminary investigations suggest he acted alone, with no accomplices, and was 100% inspired by the Islamic State. Jabbar had posted videos online proclaiming his support for the group and had planted homemade bombs in drinks coolers. The attack occurred just before President Joe Biden's term began, and Trump linked it to "OPEN BORDERS." The FBI is now focusing on Jabbar's radicalisation, with no definitive link to the Las Vegas incident where a Tesla Cybertruck exploded.

images.alt_text: Police investigators surround a white truck that has been crashed into a work lift in the French Quarter of New Orleans, Louisiana, Jan 1, 2025. At least 10 people were killed and 30 injured.
The remains of a covered Tesla Cybertruck that exploded at the entrance of Trump Tower in Las Vegas, Nevada, Jan 1, 2025.
Police investigators surround a white truck that has been crashed into a work lift in the French Quarter of New Orleans, Louisiana, Jan 1, 2025. At least 10 people were killed and 30 injured.

site_title: Oil prices settle up on China optimism as investors return from holiday
summary: Oil prices rose by over $1 a barrel on the first trading day of 2025, settling at $75.93 a barrel for Brent crude futures and $73.13 a barrel for US West Texas Intermediate crude. The increase was driven by optimism over China's economy and fuel demand, following President Xi Jinping's pledge to promote growth. However, swelling US petrol and distillate inventories and concerns about US President-elect Donald Trump's tariffs on China limited gains, with prices expected to remain constrained near $70 a barrel in 2025.

images.alt_text: Brent crude futures rose 46 cents, or 0.6 per cent, to US$75.10 a barrel by 0128 GMT on Thursday after settling up 65 cents on Tuesday, the last trading day for 2024.

site_title: Keppel DC Reit to divest Malaysia data centre for RM55.6 million
summary: Keppel DC Reit is divesting its 99% stake in the Basis Bay Data Centre in Cyberjaya, Malaysia for RM55.6 million (S$16.9 million). The divestment, expected to be completed by the third quarter of 2025, is part of the Reit's proactive asset management strategy to optimise portfolio performance. The sale is not expected to have a material impact on the Reit's net asset value and distribution per unit for the financial year ending December 31, 2025.

images.alt_text: Crystal Heng
Newly-issued preferential offering units will begin trading on the Singapore Exchange mainboard as at 9am on Wednesday (Dec 18), said Keppel DC Real Estate Investment Trust's manager.

site_title: Biden to block US Steel sale to Japanese buyer: Washington Post
summary: US President Joe Biden has decided to block the $14.9-billion sale of US Steel to Japanese buyer Nippon Steel, despite efforts by some of his senior advisers to approve the deal. The decision was made despite concerns that it could harm US-Japan relations. The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) had previously referred the decision to Biden. The move comes after US Steel shareholders voted overwhelmingly to approve the acquisition last April, but was opposed by the powerful United Steelworkers union and politicians.

images.alt_text: An employee enters the human resources and educational building for Japanese company Nippon Steel during a media tour at their East Nippon Works Kashima Area facility in Kashima, Ibaraki prefecture, north of Tokyo on December 6, 2024. (Photo by Richard A. Brooks / AFP)

site_title: US: Wall St opens higher in first trading session of 2025
summary: Wall Street opened higher on the first trading session of 2025, with the Dow Jones rising 115.9 points, or 0.27%, to 42,660.09. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite also opened higher, with gains of 21.6 points, or 0.37%, and 93.1 points, or 0.48%, respectively. Investors are optimistic about a fresh political landscape and potential interest rate cuts that could enhance corporate and economic performance.

site_title: Nvidia’s remarkable stock surge mints three board billionaires
summary: Nvidia's stock surged 171% in 2024, making it the second-best performer on the S&P 500 Index, fueled by soaring demand for artificial intelligence chips. Three of the chipmaker's longest-serving board members, Tench Coxe, Mark Stevens, and Harvey Jones, became billionaires, with Coxe's net worth reaching $5.4 billion, Stevens' at $9.3 billion, and Jones' at $1 billion. This rare feat highlights the company's growth and the success of its directors, who received equity awards as incentives to grow the company and improve its performance.

images.alt_text: Nvidia dominates the market for AI graphics processors and commands about 80 per cent of its share.
All of Nvidia’s AI semiconductors now use Ibiden’s substrates, although Taiwanese rivals such as Unimicron Technology are eyeing the field.

site_title: Healthtech, access and financial fluency: The future of women and alts
summary: Women are driving change in the alternative investment landscape, fueled by growing wealth, financial fluency, and access to new platforms. Over 50 finance industry leaders share insights on the key factors influencing women's investment behaviors, including healthcare innovations, digital transformation, and regulatory frameworks. Women are increasingly investing in healthtech and femtech, and are driving innovation in the sector. Cultural dynamics, regulatory environments, and societal shifts are also shaping the future of alternative investments, with women playing a leading role in breaking barriers and shaping the industry.

images.alt_text: Barbara Stewart
Do women want alts? The answer is a resounding yes. Women need and deserve equal access to the world’s fastest-growing asset class.

site_title: Globetrotting in 2025 – oh, the places you’ll go!
summary: According to a Skyscanner report, 53% of Singapore travellers polled want to make more trips in 2025, driven by desires to explore new destinations and experiences, such as stargazing and using artificial intelligence to design itineraries.

images.alt_text: Discover the unspoilt beauty of Sapa's mountainous surroundings.

site_title: Computers of senior US Treasury leaders accessed in latest hack
summary: US Treasury officials' computers were hacked by Chinese state-sponsored hackers, compromising around 100 government computers. The breach allowed hackers to access unclassified material, including drafts and notes for policy decisions, itineraries, and internal communications. The hackers accessed the computers through a software provider, BeyondTrust Inc., which has since been taken offline. Chinese officials have denied US allegations of state-sponsored cyberattacks, but the breach has raised concerns about the Treasury's sanctions deliberations and economic policy.

images.alt_text: US officials have become more pointed in their criticism of China's cyber threats and have vowed further punitive actions.

The incident happened earlier this month, when a China state-sponsored actor compromised a third-party cybersecurity service provider and was able to remotely access the Treasury workstations and some unclassified documents, a US Treasury spokesperson said.
Ttelecom carriers including AT&T and Verizon were hit by the Salt Typhoon network intrusions.
Salt Typhoon is the name given to the hacking group behind the attacks.
Browser extensions are typically used by Internet users to customise their Web-browsing experiences, for example by automatically applying coupons to shopping websites.

site_title: Do Kwon pleads not guilty to US charges over Terra collapse
summary: Do Kwon, co-founder of Terraform Labs, pleaded not guilty to nine US counts, including wire, securities, and commodities fraud, related to the $40 billion collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin. Kwon, 33, faces prosecution in the Manhattan US attorney's office and will be held without bail. He was extradited to the US from Montenegro, where he was arrested in March 2023 for traveling on a fake passport. Kwon's lawyer had no comment after the hearing, and a conference in the case is scheduled for January 8.

images.alt_text: Cryptocurrencies have come under increasing scrutiny from regulators after a string of controversies in recent years, including the high-profile collapse of the exchange FTX.
The SEC has often touted its success in court in obtaining judgments that align with its view that decades-old securities laws apply to the upstart digital asset class.
Do Kwon faces related criminal charges both in the United States and his native South Korea.
Three Arrows, once one of crypto’s most famous hedge funds, collapsed soon after Luna and TerraUSD crashed along with a handful of other large crypto businesses.

Terraform Labs and its founder Do Kwon tentatively settle with SEC over alleged misleading of cryptocurrency investors before TerraUSD's 2022 collapse.

site_title: Apple to pay US$95 million to settle Siri privacy lawsuit
summary: Apple has agreed to pay US$95 million to settle a class action lawsuit claiming its Siri assistant violated users' privacy. The lawsuit alleged that Apple routinely recorded private conversations after users activated Siri unintentionally and disclosed them to third parties like advertisers. The settlement requires approval by US district judge Jeffrey White and could result in up to US$20 per Siri-enabled device for estimated tens of millions of class members. Apple denied wrongdoing in agreeing to settle, which amounts to about nine hours of profit for the company.

site_title: Thai economic uncertainty has increased, central bank minutes say
summary: Thai economic uncertainty has increased due to unclear US economic policies, according to Bank of Thailand's (BOT) Dec 18 monetary policy meeting minutes. The BOT left the one-day repurchase rate unchanged at 2.25%, citing heightened uncertainties. The central bank maintained its forecast for economic growth at 2.7% in 2024 and 2.9% in 2025, with inflation expected to remain near the target range of 1-3%. The MPC deemed it essential to monitor credit quality and growth developments to maximize the effectiveness of monetary policy.

images.alt_text: Thailand's household debt, which currently stands at about 90 per cent of GDP, is too high, says Bank of Thailand governor Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput.

Under new rules being shepherded by the OECD, a minimum 15 per cent tax will be charged on multinationals with an annual global turnover of more than 750 million euros (S$1.06 billion), regardless of their location.
The BOT has cut its benchmark rate by a quarter point this year, to 2.25 per cent, but at its most recent meeting held borrowing costs unchanged.

site_title: 10-year average return on Singapore Savings Bonds slides to 2.82%
summary: The 10-year average return on Singapore Savings Bonds (SSBs) has dropped to 2.82% for the latest February issuance, following the US Federal Reserve's rate cuts. The February tranche offers S$500 million and closes on Jan 24, with a first-year interest rate of 2.76%. This marks a decrease from the preceding tranche's 2.86% average return. The SSB interest rates are adjusted to prevent yields from dropping over time, ensuring returns increase across holding periods.

images.alt_text: Crystal Heng
The latest issuance will be allotted on Nov 27, with successful applications issued on Dec 2.
The latest tranche offers a first-year interest rate of 2.66 per cent, and a 10-year average return of 2.81 per cent.

site_title: Medtech startup Lucence secures expanded US Medicare nod for cancer test
summary: Medtech startup Lucence has secured expanded Medicare approval for its LiquidHallmark cancer test, enabling patients to claim up to US$2,919 for the test, which profiles 80 genes and detects 15 types of cancer through a blood test. This is the only provider with Medicare coverage for a test combining circulating tumour DNA and RNA analyses. The test offers a faster and less-invasive alternative to traditional biopsies, delivering results within one to two weeks and allowing patients to be matched with appropriate treatments more quickly.

images.alt_text: Renald Yeo
The Kimen Group is developing a boutique residential project in London and doing it from scratch.

site_title: Sias calls for independent inquiry into SingPost’s dismissal of senior executives
summary: SingPost's dismissal of three senior executives has raised critical questions among shareholders, investors, and the market. Sias, the Securities Investors Association (Singapore), is calling for an independent inquiry into the incident. Association leader David Gerald stated that shareholders deserve better and informed decisions regarding their investments. The sudden dismissal of the executives and their vigorous denial of allegations have necessitated detailed explanations, highlighting an extremely serious breach of rules.

images.alt_text: Crystal Heng
Two phases of the investigation are outlined in SingPost’s response to stakeholders.
The senior management staff stressed that the full facts only became known after the external forensics team’s investigations established the causative correlation.

site_title: India’s December factory activity growth hits 2024 low: PMI
summary: India's manufacturing activity grew in December at its weakest pace for the year, with the HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index falling to 56.4, the lowest since December 2023. Despite easing cost pressures, softer demand and slower growth in new orders, manufacturing output has shown sustained expansion above 50 for the past three-and-a-half years. International conditions improved, with exports growing at the fastest rate in five months, and manufacturing firms continued to hire staff for the 10th straight month.

images.alt_text: Villagers fill water from a well in Shahapur, Maharashtra, amid an ongoing heatwave, May 26, 2024. Far from India's financial capital Mumbai, impoverished villages in areas supplying the megacity's water are running dry - a crisis repeated across the country that experts say foreshadows terrifying problems. Demand is increasing in the world's most populous nation of 1.4 billion people, but supplies are shrinking - with climate change driving erratic rainfall and extreme heat.
Adani Enterprises will sell a 13 per cent stake in Adani Wilmar to comply with India’s minimum public shareholding requirements.
Verna is presently head of institutional banking group at DBS Bank India.

site_title: EY calls for innovation advancement support, tax system tweaks in its Budget 2025 wish list
summary: Professional services firm EY has released its Budget 2025 wish list, calling for enhanced support for research, innovation, and digital economy in Singapore. The firm proposes measures to boost cybersecurity, artificial intelligence adoption, and skills development, as well as tweaks to the tax system to make it more relevant and flexible. EY also recommends increasing support for workers, families, and individuals, including wage subsidies for older workers and a fund for training and policy development costs. The firm aims to position Singapore for sustainable, inclusive growth and encourages active participation among individuals and enterprises.

images.alt_text: Elysia Tan
Deloitte also made recommendations to enhance the Refundable Investment Credit (RIC) incentive scheme.
To support senior workers, SNEF asked the government to extend the Senior Employment Credit beyond 2025.

site_title: Chinese cuisine gets a novel rethink at ASU
summary: Ace Tan's new restaurant ASU in Labrador Park, Singapore, offers a novel take on traditional Chinese cuisine, blending innovation with accessibility. The restaurant features unique dishes such as pidan tofu, crab gyoza, and braised quail, showcasing Tan's creativity. With a stage-like interior, ASU is open for dinner only, Wednesday to Sunday, from 6 pm to 11 pm. The restaurant's unique concept and menu have garnered attention in the Singaporean food scene, positioning ASU as a notable addition to the city's dining landscape.

images.alt_text: Shisen Hanten's impressively renovated interiors.

site_title: Retail traders seek nearly US$60 billion for toymaker Bloks Group’s Hong Kong IPO
summary: Retail traders in Hong Kong have applied to borrow nearly $60 billion to participate in Chinese toymaker Bloks Group's initial public offering (IPO), which is set to list on January 10. Individual investors have sought to bid for over 3,000 times the number of shares reserved for them, with some allocating 10% of the shares to retail investors. This follows a trend seen in smaller deals last year, where high subscription multiples attracted significant interest from individual investors. Hong Kong's stock exchange is also considering changes to its requirements for IPOs, including the clawback mechanism.

images.alt_text: The listing plans come while there look to be green shoots of recovery in the Hong Kong IPO market following an extended downturn period over the last few years.

site_title: Vietnam provides support for state workers affected by bureaucratic overhaul
summary: Vietnam's government has introduced three decrees to support officials and civil servants affected by a bureaucratic reform aimed at increasing governance efficiency and saving the state budget. The reform, estimated to cost around $7 billion, is expected to save 113 trillion dong in the next five years. The restructuring scheme is part of a broader effort to address the country's bloated bureaucracy, which currently spends over 70% of the state budget on regular expenses.

images.alt_text: Vietnam Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has urged officials to focus on disbursing public investment from the start of 2025 to create growth momentum.
Responding to investor discontent, Vietnam's new Communist Party leader To Lam launched a massive overhaul of state bodies in December.
Vietnam expects its stock market to be upgraded in 2025 by FTSE to emerging market, from the current frontier status.

site_title: Countdown to Singapore Art Week: 4 shows you can experience now
summary: The Jean-Michel Basquiat: Behind The Canvas Series 1 exhibition is now open at Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, ahead of Singapore Art Week. The immersive show, featuring 10 rooms, recreates the vibe of 1980s New York, which inspired the artist's iconic works. This world's first exhibition showcases Basquiat's art in a spatial spectacle, with striking set designs and interactive installations. The exhibition runs until Jan 26, 2025.

site_title: Dollar resumes upward trend, euro hits lowest since Nov 2022
summary: The euro fell to a 8-year low of US$1.0314, down 0.3% on the day, as the dollar built on last year's strong gains due to expectations of high US interest rates and potential rate cuts from the European Central Bank. The dollar also reached new multi-month highs against the pound, while the euro's decline accelerated after breaking through resistance. US President-elect Donald Trump's policies are expected to boost growth and add to dollar demand, underpinning US Treasury yields and further strengthening the dollar.

site_title: Indonesia’s December inflation rate eases to 1.57% yoy, just below forecast
summary: Indonesia's annual inflation rate eased to a historic low of 1.57% in December, slightly below market expectations. The decrease is attributed to subdued consumer demand, stable global energy prices, and the fading impact of weather-related food price shocks. The central bank has targeted inflation in 2024 and 2025 to be between 1.5 and 3.5%, and the current rate is a positive sign for the economy.

images.alt_text: Elisa Valenta
Indonesia's Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati said Indonesia's budget deficit was almost as narrow as the government’s original plan to keep the fiscal gap at 2.29 per cent of GDP.

site_title: Europe: Stocks jump into 2025, powered by energy sector gains
summary: Europe's Stoxx 600 index rose 0.6% to 510.67 on Thursday, reversing modest losses, as investors returned from New Year holidays. The energy sector led gains, jumping 2.3% as crude prices surged 2% following China's President Xi Jinping's pledge to promote growth, the world's top crude importer. The sector's surge was driven by a 2% increase in global oil prices. The rally marked a strong start to 2025, with investors analyzing fresh US economic data.

images.alt_text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average ended 0.4 per cent lower at 42,392.27 on the first day on trading of the year.

site_title: Nick Clegg leaves Meta global policy team
summary: Former British deputy prime minister Nick Clegg is stepping down as president of Meta's global affairs, a role he joined in 2018 amidst the Cambridge Analytica scandal. He will be replaced by Joel Kaplan, a Republican stalwart who served under George W. Bush. Clegg's departure comes as Republican Donald Trump is set to return to the White House, marking a shift in the company's leadership during a period of growing scrutiny and controversy.

site_title: Musk ally Meloni emerges as global political player
summary: Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is emerging as a global political player, thanks to her pragmatic approach and ties to US President-elect Donald Trump. She is set to meet Biden in Rome, where she will showcase her chairing of the G7 in 2024. Meloni's growing prominence is due to her ideological bond with Trump, who shares her views on immigration and clamping down on immigration. Her close relationship with Tesla CEO Elon Musk, a member of Trump's inner circle, has also contributed to her international influence. Despite concerns over her authoritarian tendencies, Meloni's success in office has made her a key player in European politics, with the potential to shape the continent's foreign policy and economy.

images.alt_text: Elon Musk and Giorgia Meloni have met on a number of occasions, including at a political festival last December.

site_title: CapitaLand Investment foresees heightened macro, geopolitical uncertainties in 2025
summary: CapitaLand Investment's group CEO Lee Chee Koon expects heightened macro and geopolitical uncertainties in 2025, citing the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict, Middle-East crisis, and slower China recovery as potential risks. Despite these challenges, Lee remains optimistic, focusing on expanding capabilities and creating sustainable long-term enterprise value through organic and inorganic growth in the US and Europe. The company will prioritize efficiency, capital fundraising, and stakeholder relationships to navigate these risks and drive long-term success.

Gold prices kicked off 2025 on a positive note, influenced by Fed and Trump policy in focus. The market focus remains on the impact of the US dollar and tariffs, with investors closely monitoring economic trends.

site_title: As Musk gains influence, questions hover over US probes into his empire
summary: US investigations into Elon Musk's business empire, including at least 20 ongoing probes, are uncertain under the incoming Trump administration. Musk has called himself Trump's "first buddy" and has been in frequent contact with the president-elect. Trump's transition team has praised Musk, calling him a "brilliant" entrepreneur, and has vowed to ensure law and order. However, some experts fear that Trump's appointees may drop or languish Musk-related cases, citing Trump's history of defending his allies and his own business dealings. Musk's companies, including Tesla, SpaceX, and Neuralink, have faced scrutiny over alleged securities violations, safety concerns, and environmental issues.

site_title: Daily Debrief: What Happened Today (Jan 2)
summary: Singapore's private home prices rose 2.3% in Q4 2024, bringing the full-year increase to 3.9%, according to the Urban Redevelopment Authority. Housing and Development Board (HDB) resale prices climbed 2.5% in Q4 and 9.6% for 2024. Meanwhile, the Monetary Authority of Singapore's equities market review group is exploring the use of seed capital to attract more commercial capital. Singapore shares rose 0.4% on the first trading day of 2025, despite regional declines.

site_title: South Korea's Yoon, facing unprecedented arrest over martial law, vows to 'fight until end'
summary: South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol has vowed to "fight until the end" as he faces an attempt to arrest him over his short-lived martial law, which led to his impeachment. A court has approved a warrant for his arrest, and the Corruption Investigation Office has until January 6 to execute it. Yoon's supporters have gathered near his official residence, while the opposition Democratic Party has described his actions as "delusional" and "inciting an extreme clash."

images.alt_text: Choi's appointment of two new judges on Dec 31 raises the likelihood of a ruling to finalise the removal of President Yoon Suk-yeol.
Anyone trying to block authorities from arresting Yoon Suk-yeol could face prosecution, say South Korean investigators.

site_title: PBOC seen delaying RRR cut after adding liquidity via new tools
summary: The People's Bank of China (PBOC) is expected to delay cutting the reserve requirement ratio (RRR) due to concerns about the impact on the Chinese currency, particularly in light of potential US tariffs. Despite injecting 1.7 trillion yuan in liquidity at the end of 2024, the PBOC is keeping its powder dry on a RRR cut, which could add pressure to the yuan. Officials are instead focusing on stabilizing markets and preserving policy space ahead of US President-elect Donald Trump's return to office.

images.alt_text: The market has ramped up bets on sizeable interest-rate reductions next year, sending China’s sovereign bond yields to record lows.
Allowing the yuan to depreciate next year would deviate from the usual practice of keeping the foreign exchange rate stable.
The People’s Bank of China (PBOC) vowed zero tolerance for bond market “misbehaviors” and held meetings with some financial institutions involved in aggressive bond trading during the current rally.

site_title: MAS review group exploring use of seed capital for equities market: Gan Kim Yong
summary: Singapore's Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is studying how to make optimum use of seed capital to attract more commercial capital into the local equities market. Minister for Trade and Industry Gan Kim Yong emphasized the need for sustained crowding in commercial capital to stimulate market interest and maintain trading liquidity. The review group aims to position Singapore's equities market as an attractive listing venue for high-quality mid-cap growth companies, and Gan called for a review of the regulatory framework to ensure it empowers good companies to list and allows consumers to make informed investment decisions.

site_title: Economists stick to 2025 Singapore growth outlook, but warn of downside risks
summary: Singapore's economy expanded 4% year-over-year in 2024, beating the official forecast of 3.5%. Economists predict 2025 growth will range from 1-3%, citing downside risks from US President-elect Donald Trump's tariff plan and rising geopolitical tensions. Despite this, the economy is expected to benefit from sustained growth in trade-related sectors and a favorable global tech cycle. Private-sector economists generally maintained their forecasts, with some predicting 2.5-3% growth in 2025.

images.alt_text: Tessa Oh

site_title: Capturing South-east Asia’s renewable energy opportunity
summary: South-east Asia, home to a vibrant digital ecosystem, is poised to make a significant impact on the development of emerging technologies like AI. However, the region's growing energy demands, particularly for clean energy, pose a challenge. The Asia Clean Energy Coalition (ACEC) recognizes the private sector's role in accelerating the transition to a clean energy future through diversified and cost-effective procurement options. Countries like Vietnam and Malaysia have implemented measures to promote private-sector investment in clean energy, such as direct power purchase agreements (DPPAs) and virtual power purchase agreements (PPAs). These efforts aim to create a "win-win-win" scenario for consumers, developers, and regional grids.

The Straits Times Index (STI) ended at 3,800.81, while the Singapore Exchange (SGX) fell 1.8%. Regional markets declined, with Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index dropping 2.2%. site_title: Ten hurt in shooting at New York City nightclub
summary: A mass shooting in New York City's Queens borough on New Year's Day injured 10 people, with six females and four males expected to recover. The incident occurred when 3-4 males opened fire outside a private events club, with police ruling out a terrorist attack. The shooting comes hours after two other acts of violence in the US, including a truck ploughing into a street in New Orleans, killing 15 people, and a Tesla truck exploding outside a Trump hotel in Las Vegas, killing one person and injuring seven.

site_title: CDL, Frasers, Sekisui launch The Orie at Toa Payoh from S$2,400 to S$2,500 per sq ft
summary: City Developments Ltd (CDL), Frasers Property, and Sekisui House launched The Orie in Toa Payoh, Singapore, with prices starting at S$2,400 to S$2,500 per sq ft. The 99-year leasehold development features 777 units across two 40-storey towers, with preview and booking starting on Jan 3 and Jan 18, respectively. The project marks the first private residential launch in Toa Payoh since 2016, with the site acquired for S$968 million in November 2023.

site_title: Apple offers iPhone discounts in China as competition intensifies
summary: Apple is offering discounts of up to 500 yuan (S$93) on its latest iPhone models in China to defend its market share against rising competition from domestic rivals like Huawei. The discounts will be available on specific iPhone models from January 4 to 7, and apply to purchases using certain payment methods. The move comes as Apple grapples with declining market share in China, where local manufacturers have intensified competition, and consumers remain cautious amid China's slowing economy and deflationary pressures.

site_title: Singapore business sentiment improves for 2025; manpower costs, uncertain demand still top concerns
summary: Singapore businesses remain optimistic about the economic outlook for 2025, with 51% expecting the economy to remain the same in the next 12 months. Despite rising manpower costs and demand uncertainty, companies are turning to cost-saving initiatives and price hikes to offset pressures. The majority of businesses expect to maintain or increase profitability, with 54% not facing liquidity issues. The government is expected to provide support in the 2025 Budget, with businesses prioritizing revenue growth, talent attraction and retention, and financial resilience.

site_title: Thai government says Bank of Thailand chair appointment won’t take too long
summary: The Thai government expects a selection panel to quickly choose a new chairman for the Bank of Thailand, following the rejection of former finance minister Kittiratt Na-Ranong due to his ties with the ruling party. The panel, composed of former civil servants and regulators, will decide on a strategy and consider two remaining candidates, Kulit Sombatsiri and academic Surapon Nitikraipot. The delay in appointing a new chair has allowed Porametee Vimolsiri to hold temporary charge, and the government is pushing for interest rate cuts to bolster the economy, which is expected to grow 2.9% this year.

Bank of Thailand Governor Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput also said debt support measures would be announced next week.

site_title: China may miss target for cleaning up largest steel industry
summary: China is likely to miss its target of producing 15% of steel using electric-arc furnaces by the end of 2025, with the average operating rate for these furnaces dropping to 49% in 2024, down from 54% in 2023. The steel industry is facing challenges from a sluggish economy and a debilitating real estate crisis, which has damaged prices and sparked output cuts. Despite efforts to clean up production and meet climate targets, China remains the world's largest polluter and biggest steelmaker, with electric-arc furnaces producing only 9.9% of total output in 2023.

images.alt_text: Steel mills have been forced to slash output to protect margins hammered by China’s protracted property crisis.

site_title: Cybertruck explodes outside Trump hotel in Las Vegas, killing one
summary: A Tesla Cybertruck exploded outside the Trump International Hotel in Las Vegas, killing one person and injuring seven others. The incident occurred when the electric vehicle pulled up to the hotel's glass entrance before a "large explosion." Authorities are investigating the incident as a possible terrorist act, with the FBI leading the probe. The White House has offered federal assistance to the victims, and President Joe Biden was briefed on the incident.

images.alt_text: Uber does not, for example, currently separate out its payments to drivers, to restaurants and to insurance providers as part of its “gross bookings” in quarterly financial statements.

Elon Musk's close relationship with incoming US president Donald Trump helped increase the value of his companies, including Tesla, SpaceX and xAI.

site_title: Lendlease, Warburg Pincus appoint Bart Price as CEO of Apac R&D joint venture
summary: Lendlease and Warburg Pincus have appointed Bart Price as CEO of their Asia-Pacific real estate joint venture for life sciences, research and development, and innovation. Based in Singapore, Price brings 20 years of experience in real estate, infrastructure investments, and capital markets to the role. He will oversee strategic growth plans, scale opportunities, and generate outsized returns for investment partners.

images.alt_text: Chloe Lim
Justin Gabbani, chief executive officer (Investment Management) at Lendlease.

site_title: SingPost taps ex-Singapore CEO Neo Su Yin as group COO to help steady the ship
summary: SingPost appoints Neo Su Yin as its new group chief operating officer (COO), effective January 2. She will oversee the group's Singapore and international business units and property, working closely with board chairman Simon Israel. The appointment comes after SingPost sacked three senior executives. Neo will review the group's international business unit as part of her new role.

images.alt_text: Chong Xin Wei
“However, no system of internal controls, no matter how robust, can provide absolute assurance against deliberate misconduct or fraud,” says SingPost.

site_title: Australian house prices drop for the first time in 22 months
summary: Australian house prices declined 0.2% in December for the first time in 22 months, according to CoreLogic. Higher interest rates, a shortage of homes, and booming population growth have triggered a housing crisis in parts of Australia. Major cities like Melbourne and Sydney led the declines, while Perth and Adelaide saw gains. The housing market is expected to experience a soft start to 2025, with a potential rebound in value growth once interest rates start coming down.

images.alt_text: Global “hyperscalers”, or large-scale cloud service providers,  have been spending billions on data centres to cater to the growing demand for AI services.

site_title: Oil rises as investors return from holidays, eye China recovery
summary: Oil prices rose 0.6% to $75.10 a barrel on the first day of 2025, as investors cautiously eyed China's economic recovery. Brent crude futures increased 46 cents, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures rose 49 cents. The price hike follows President Xi Jinping's New Year's address, in which he pledged to implement more proactive policies to promote growth in 2025.

images.alt_text: Analysts expect oil output to rise to a new record of 13.5 million barrels per day in 2025.

site_title: Bank of Korea governor says monetary easing this year will be flexible
summary: Bank of Korea governor Rhee Chang-yong stated that monetary policy easing this year will be flexible due to heightened economic uncertainty. The BOK delivered its first back-to-back rate cut since 2009 in its final policy meeting of 2024. Governor Rhee emphasized the need for flexibility and agility in monetary policy operations, citing unprecedented political and economic uncertainty. This move aims to address the challenges facing the South Korean economy in 2025.

images.alt_text: The Bank of Korea lowered its benchmark interest rate by a quarter percentage point to 3.00 per cent at its monetary policy review, an outcome only four of 38 economists polled by Reuters foresaw.
South Korea is heavily reliant on exports for economic growth and financial stability.
Predicting growth for 2025 has become more complicated as exports fell in real terms last quarter, Rhee Chang-yong says.

site_title: Gold kicks off 2025 on positive note, Fed and Trump policy in focus
summary: Gold started 2025 on a positive note, with spot gold steady at $2,625.48 per ounce. The asset had a stellar 2024, surging 27% and its largest annual gain since 2010. Market participants are closely watching the US Federal Reserve's interest rate outlook and President-elect Donald Trump's tariff policies, which have implications for gold's appeal as a hedge against inflation and economic uncertainty.

images.alt_text: XXX

site_title: Asia’s factories hold onto growth as Trump’s tariff threat looms
summary: Asia's factories continued to expand in December, with new orders and output improving, despite weaker confidence and a sustained drop in export orders. The purchasing managers index (PMI) gauge for South-east Asia eased slightly to 50.7, capping the year's growth at 51 for 2024. Taiwan's PMI registered the highest reading since July, while China's manufacturing activity expanded at a slower pace. The data comes ahead of US President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration, which may lead to tariffs on China and imports, posing risks to global growth and domestic demand.

images.alt_text: ADB said that changes to US trade, fiscal, and immigration policies could slow growth and drive inflation higher in developing Asia.
The BOK has stepped up its measures to stabilise markets since the martial-law row erupted and pledged “unlimited liquidity” if necessary in coordination with the government.
China’s factory activity expanded at the fastest pace in five months in November as new orders.

site_title: South Korea sharply trims GDP forecast after martial law fiasco
summary: South Korea sharply cut its economic growth forecast for 2025 to 1.8% after a constitutional crisis led to the impeachment of President Yoon Suk-yeol and martial law, which has weakened private consumption and export momentum. The Finance Ministry's revised forecast is 0.1 percentage point lower than the Bank of Korea's November view. The government has pledged unlimited liquidity to mitigate the economic fallout, with some economists speculating that the Bank of Korea may lower its benchmark interest rate in January, potentially for a third consecutive cut.

images.alt_text: The trade-reliant South Korean economy barely grew in the third quarter amid slowing exports.
XXX
Economists see weak private spending, a cooling export rally and deteriorating consumer confidence as factors driving the BOK to accelerate its easing next year.

site_title: Asian LNG prices set to rise after Russia-Ukraine transit ends
summary: Asian LNG prices are expected to rise following Russia's halt of gas flows to Europe via Ukraine, a key conduit for over five decades. The move tightens the global LNG market, with supply expected to remain tight. Europe will need to replace 5% of its gas, relying more on storage, which is below average levels. LNG prices in Asia are not yet fully reflecting the 50% increase in Europe's gas benchmark, which closed 2024 up more than 50%. This could lead to higher prices for alternatives in the region.

site_title: Singapore’s private home prices swing up 2.3% in Q4 on strong new launch sales, taking 2024 gain to 3.9%
summary: Singapore's private home prices rose 2.3% in Q4 2024, bringing the full-year increase to 3.9%, according to the Urban Redevelopment Authority. Strong new launch sales and a 25% increase in transaction volume to 6,715 units in Q4 drove the growth, reversing a 0.7% dip in the previous quarter. The Q4 jump was attributed to strong buying at new launches, while existing projects benefited from a rebound in demand.

images.alt_text: Jessie Lim
2024 has been an unprecedented one for Singapore's private residential market, with contrasting performance in new home sales and non-awards for state land tenders.

site_title: Indonesia says 2024 budget deficit lower than 2.7% of GDP estimate
summary: Indonesia's Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati announced that the country's 2024 budget deficit came in below the estimated 2.7% of GDP, nearly matching the government's original plan of 2.29% of GDP. The deficit was attributed to a positive growth in overall revenue, despite coming in below target, and a 6% increase in spending due to election-related expenses and infrastructure projects. This narrow deficit is seen as a "remarkable result" and a "strong foundation" for the country's economy in 2025.

images.alt_text: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto greets people as he passes by a venue where people celebrate the New Year's Eve in Jakarta, Indonesia, December 31, 2024. REUTERS/Willy Kurniawan
Bank Indonesia initially boosted purchases of government debt during the Covid years in an extraordinary measure to help fund the state budget.
Hasto Krsitiyanto is accused of being involved in the bribery of a former election commission official.

site_title: AEM appoints Kwek You-Cheer as new CFO
summary: AEM appoints Kwek You-Cheer, 48, as its new Chief Financial Officer (CFO) effective immediately. Kwek brings over 20 years of experience in strategic financial leadership and operations internationally, most recently serving as CFO at Lenovo's Asia Pacific Infrastructure Solutions Group. AEM's CEO Amy Leong stated that Kwek's experience will be an invaluable asset to the team, helping achieve robust growth with improved operational efficiency.

images.alt_text: Chloe Lim

site_title: ❓ The big questions for 2025
summary:
Key takeaways for 2025 include: 

- Remote work may become extinct in Singapore as more companies introduce return-to-office mandates, despite a survey showing workers prefer flexibility.
- Certificate of Entitlement (COE) prices for mass-market cars are expected to decrease as the Land Transport Authority injects more COEs into the market.
- Singapore's next general election, set for this year, is likely to be won by the ruling People's Action Party (PAP) under Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.
- Inflation has cooled in 2024, but experts warn of potential risks and cost-of-living issues that may be addressed in Budget 2025.
- The Singapore stock market is expected to outperform in 2025 if market reforms are introduced, with analysts hoping for substantial measures to revive the market.

site_title: Growth in China’s factory activity slows: Caixin PMI
summary: China's factory activity grew in December but at a slower pace, with the Caixin/S&P Global manufacturing purchasing managers index (PMI) dropping to 50.5 from 51.5 in November. New export orders declined for the fourth month in five, citing subdued external economic conditions and US tariff threats. Chinese manufacturers maintained an optimistic view of output in 2025, but with decreased optimism since September. Policymakers are expected to increase household income and boost consumption to spur growth amid intensifying US-China trade tensions.

images.alt_text: China’s President Xi Jinping reiterated a call to adopt more proactive macroeconomic policies to aid the economy’s continued recovery.
China’s US$18 trillion economy has struggled to recover from the pandemic amid weak consumption and investment.
Layoffs are rare in China’s civil service, earning it the “iron rice bowl” moniker, though individuals can be dismissed for disciplinary violations.

site_title: South Korea police search Jeju Air, airport operator over fatal plane crash
summary: South Korean police have raided Jeju Air and the airport operator over a fatal plane crash that killed 179 people on Sunday. The Boeing 737-800 aircraft, which was carrying 166 passengers and 13 crew members, belly-landed and exploded into flames after hitting an embankment at Muan International Airport. Two crew members were rescued alive, but one remains in critical condition. Police are investigating the crash, including the use of a rigid embankment that may have contributed to the disaster. The investigation is ongoing, with experts questioning the design of the embankment and the pilot's actions leading up to the crash.

site_title: South Korea December factory activity shrinks as firms turn pessimistic: PMI
summary: South Korea's factory activity contracted in December, with the purchasing managers index (PMI) falling to 49 from 50.6 in November, marking the third time below the 50-mark since August. The decline was driven by weaker client confidence in the domestic market and export orders grew only marginally. Manufacturers' sentiment for the year ahead fell below the 50-threshold for the first time since July 2020, citing concerns over US trade policy and domestic politics.

images.alt_text: XXX
Economists see weak private spending, a cooling export rally and deteriorating consumer confidence as factors driving the BOK to accelerate its easing next year.

site_title: Malaysia grants WeChat, TikTok licences to operate under new law
summary: Malaysia's communications regulator granted WeChat and TikTok licenses to operate in the country under a new social media law, which requires platforms with over 8 million users to obtain a license. The law aims to tackle rising cybercrime, with WeChat having 12 million users in Malaysia. Telegram is in the final stages of obtaining its license, while Meta Platforms has begun the licensing process. Other platforms, including Facebook and WhatsApp, have not applied for licenses. The law came into effect on January 1.

images.alt_text: There are currently no interruptions to any social media or messaging services that fall under Malaysia's licensing regime.

site_title: RHB cuts IReit target to S$0.34; flags potential privatisation on further unit price declines
summary: RHB Research lowered its target price on IReit Global to S$0.34 from S$0.40, citing a 34% decline in FY2025 DPU due to the loss of its top tenant at Berlin Campus. Analysts expect higher financing costs and gearing levels, but believe redevelopment offers a path to unlock long-term value and diversify income base. Further unit price declines may attract privatisation bids from the Reit sponsor.
